pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:0.5: 60. The training rule on hiding robes
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.2: On one occasion when the monks from the group of seventeen had not put away their requisites,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.3: the monks from the group of six hid their bowls and robes.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.4: The monks from the group of seventeen said to them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.6: The monks from the group of six laughed, but the monks from the group of seventeen cried.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.9: “Because the monks from the group of six have hidden our bowls and robes.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.10: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.12: “How can the monks from the group of six hide the bowls and robes of other monks?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.13: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.16: Foolish men, how can you hide the bowls and robes of other monks?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.17: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.18: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.19: ‘If a monk hides another monk’s bowl, robe-cloth, sitting-mat, needle-case, or belt, or he gets it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Order through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.9: an iron bowl or a ceramic bowl.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.12: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.14: one with a border is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.18: there are two kinds of belts: those made from strips of cloth and those made from pigs’ intestines.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.21: if he hides it himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.23: if he asks another, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.24: If he only asks once, then even if the other hides many things, he commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.25: Even if just for a laugh:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.1: If the other monk is fully ordained, and he perceives him as fully ordained, and he hides his bowl or robe-cloth or sitting-mat or needle-case or belt, or he gets it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.2: If the other monk is fully ordained, but he is unsure if he is, and he hides his bowl or robe-cloth or sitting-mat or needle-case or belt, or he gets it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.3: If the other monk is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as fully ordained, and he hides his bowl or robe-cloth or sitting-mat or needle-case or belt, or he gets it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.4: If he hides another requisite, or he gets it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.5: If he hides the bowl or robe-cloth or other requisite of someone who is not fully ordained, or he gets it hidden, even if just for a laugh, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.6: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.7: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.8: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive him as fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.3: The tenth rule, the training rule on hiding robes, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.4: The sixth sub-chapter on alcoholic drinks is finished.
